provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. State below under which classification you are applying for registration. Also, provide as
completely as possible all information called for.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3.-41) An application for a certificate of authorization by an organization
pursuant to section 16 (2) of the Act shall be made in writing in the form
specified as Form B in Schedule 1.                                             Form B
            (2) An application pursuant to this regulation shall be accompanied
by-
      (a) in the case of a body corporate, copies of the memorandum of
             association, articles of association and the certificate of
             incorporation;
      (b) in the case of a partnership, a copy of the instrument constitutmg
          the partnership; and
      (c) the appropriate fee specdied in Schedule 2.
                 lThe inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 18~/20081
                             THE ARCHITECTS REGISTM TION REGULATIONS, 1989
                       (3) Any copy required pursuant to paragraph (2) shall carry an
              endorsement by the applicant made before a Justice of the Peace or a Notary
              Public to the effect that the copy is a true and accurate copy of the origmal.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. For the purpose of an application made pursuant to section 7 of the
Schedule I    Act, the form specified as Form C in Schedule 1 shall be issued by the
Form C.
              Registrar on the registration of a person pursuant to section 8 of the Act.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. For the purpose of section 10 of the Act, the f o h specified,as Form
Form D.       D in Schedule 1 shall be issued by the Registrar on the registration of a
              person specially registered pursuant to that section.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. Each application must be accompanied by two recent passport size photographs of the
applicant. The photographs must be certified by either a Justice of the Peace or Notary Public.
    I hereby apply for a certificate of registration as an Architect in Jamaica under the Architects
Registration Act
